problems.question: What is the phenomenon called when white light splits into its constituent colors?
problems.hint: This occurs due to the varying speeds of different wavelengths in a medium.
problems.detailed: Dispersion is the separation of white light into its component colors because different wavelengths travel at different speeds in a medium.
problems.author: Mubarak Aouda

problems.question: Which color of light bends the most when passing through a prism?
problems.hint: The bending depends on the wavelength; shorter wavelengths bend more.
problems.detailed: Violet light has the shortest wavelength and thus bends the most when passing through a prism.
problems.author: Mubarak Aouda

problems.question: Which of the following is a dispersive medium?
problems.hint: Dispersive media cause different wavelengths to travel at different speeds.
problems.detailed: Glass is a dispersive medium because it causes different wavelengths of light to refract by different amounts, leading to dispersion.
problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
